longdescription_.ldtext: User's desktop took too long to do a surface scan. now takes 30-40 mins just to boot up and ends up freezing at  the network login window. It is 3 years old with Windows95 but user cannot get any work done on it at this slow pace. He was told it needed a memory upgrade (user doesnt know how much memory it currently has) but the whole system may need to be upgraded.
solution_symptom_.ldtext: - Slow performance - Internet Explorer errors or lockups - System lockups - Excessive pop-up advertisements
solution_resolution_.ldtext: Here are the top 5 things you can do to improve your system's performance - Uninstall Unwanted ""Spyware"" and ""Adware"" - Uninstall Unused Programs - Reduce Hard Drive Clutter - Reboot the Computer - Add Memory  Submit a Service Request to address any of the above issues which require assistance.
